official-title.#text: To direct the Secretary of Veterans Affairs to make grants to eligible non-profit entities to establish clearinghouses for local information about employment opportunities and services for veterans.

sponsor.#tail: introduced the following bill; which was referred to the

header.#text: Department of Veterans Affairs grant program for veterans’ employment and services clearinghouses

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall make grants to 75 eligible entities to be used in accordance with

text.#text: To be eligible to receive a grant under this section an entity shall—
be a non-profit organization located in one of 75 cities selected by the Secretary for such purpose; and

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: an application containing such information and assurances as the
shall select the 75 cities in the United States with the largest populations of veterans.

text.#text: For purposes of the program under this section, the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: may not award a grant under this section to more than one eligible entity located in the same city.

text.#text: The recipient of a grant under this section shall use the grant to establish a clearinghouse to serve as a central location for veterans who reside in the city where the recipient is located to receive information about employment opportunities and services available for veterans in that city.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: a report containing an assessment of the grant program under this section and any recommendations of the

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}title.#text: 113 HR 3442 IH: To direct the Secretary of Veterans Affairs to make grants to eligible non-profit entities to establish clearinghouses for local information about employment opportunities and services for veterans.
